meanings.definition: Assign a date earlier than the actual one to (an event or document).
meanings.sent1: She tried redating the letter to make it seem older.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist is redating the ancient artifact to uncover its true age.
meanings.sent3: By redating the invitation, she hoped to trick her friends into thinking it was sent earlier.
meanings.sent4: Redating the painting was like turning back the hands of time.
meanings.sent5: The detective's job was to redating the crime scene accurately.

meanings.definition: Establish or determine the date of (an event or document) as being earlier than previously thought.
meanings.sent1: The historian redating the manuscript found surprising results.
meanings.sent2: After redating the fossil, the scientist realized it was much older than expected.
meanings.sent3: Redating the party invitation made it seem like a time-traveling mix-up.
meanings.sent4: The new evidence forced them to redating the historical event.
meanings.sent5: The professor's expertise lay in redating ancient texts accurately.
